p: The infection presents with a skin rash and simultaneously the CD8 + T cell-mediated clearance and adaptive immune response appear. Measles RNA persists after the virus has been cleared, and can be detected in blood, saliva, urine and lymphoid tissue for months [ 81]. The virus can spread across the synapses once in the neurons and accumulate mutations, and the infection then becomes chronic [ 81]. CXCL10 and CCL5 were identified as important role players in a mouse model, but the pathogenesis may further be influenced by the different CNS cell types, such as astrocytes or microglia, involved [ 3]. Severe immunosuppression is present in the later stages of the disease [ 75].
